sectionText: This course will introduce students to major genres of Japanese  literature from 1600 to the present.  In addition to reading major works  of prose, poetry, and drama, students will learn something of the  historical background and cultural traditions that helped shape these  literary works.   All readings are in English.  No knowledge of East  Asian languages or prior coursework on East Asian cultures is required.   This course satisfies the General Education Criteria for Literature and  the Arts, and Non-Western Cultures course.  Same as CWL 312.
